oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Funeral Invitation of Addie D. Brien
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Small, black-bordered funeral invition for Addie D. Brien, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. M. M. Brien, Jr. At the bottom of the invitation is a note requesting that the members of Tulip Street Sabbath School meet at the church at 8 o'clock to attend the funeral.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Invitations
Invitation cards
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tulip Street Methodist Church was organized in 1859, but the construction of the first church building was interrupted by the Civil War, and the present-day building was not completed until 1892.
